com.austinv11.collectiveframework.utils.security

Class Encryption

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.austinv11.collectiveframework.utils.security.Encryption

  • public final class Encryption
extends java.lang.Object
    This class simplifies and attempts to merge all java cipher/encryption apis

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Encryption.EncryptionType
      Eases the management of algorithms, modes, and padding See http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/technotes/guides/security/StandardNames.html#Cipher for a description of each.

      • encrypt

        public static SecretValue<java.lang.String,byte[],java.lang.Integer> encrypt(java.lang.String string,
                                                             java.lang.String algorithm,
                                                             byte[] key,
                                                             byte[] initializationVector)
                                                                      throws javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException,
                                                                             java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                                                             java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException,
                                                                             java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                                                                             javax.crypto.ShortBufferException,
                                                                             javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException,
                                                                             javax.crypto.BadPaddingException
        Encrypts a value
        Parameters:
        string - The string to encrypt
        algorithm - The algorithm, mode and padding to use
        key - The key
        initializationVector - The initialization vector
        Returns:
        The value, use getValue(SecretValue) to get the encrypted value and getMeta(SecretValue) to get the length of the encryption
        Throws:
        javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException
        java.security.InvalidKeyException
        javax.crypto.ShortBufferException
        javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException
        javax.crypto.BadPaddingException

      • decrypt

        public static SecretValue<java.lang.String,byte[],java.lang.Integer> decrypt(java.lang.String string,
                                                             int encryptionLength,
                                                             java.lang.String algorithm,
                                                             byte[] key,
                                                             byte[] initializationVector)
                                                                      throws javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException,
                                                                             java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                                                             java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException,
                                                                             java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                                                                             javax.crypto.ShortBufferException,
                                                                             javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException,
                                                                             javax.crypto.BadPaddingException
        Decrypts a value
        Parameters:
        string - The encrypted string
        encryptionLength - The length of the encryption
        algorithm - The algorithm, mode and padding to use
        key - The key
        initializationVector - The initialization vector
        Returns:
        The value, use getValue(SecretValue) to get the decrypted value and getMeta(SecretValue) to get the length of the decryption
        Throws:
        javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException
        java.security.InvalidKeyException
        javax.crypto.ShortBufferException
        javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException
        javax.crypto.BadPaddingException

        public static <V,K,M> SecretValue<V,K,M> newSecretValue(V value,
                                        K key,
                                        M meta,
                                        boolean isCallerSensitive,
                                        java.lang.String approvedCaller)
        Creates a new secret value
        Parameters:
        value - The value
        key - The key
        meta - Any metadata
        isCallerSensitive - Set this to true to limit callers (if supported on the JDK)
        approvedCaller - The only class allowed to retrieve info from it
        Returns:
        The secret value
